content.raw: I actually believe that the water should not be transparent, except by refraction. In real life, we don’t see the actual object under water, but we see the “refraction texture” of the object, not a mixture of both. For example, Fresnel effect → If view water from parallel angle, should so max reflection and min refraction \(less stuff underwater\). However, if we have the ocean transparent, then it would still be fully visible still, just not refraction effects on top. Let me know if there is something im missing.
content.html: I actually believe that the water should not be transparent, except by refraction. In real life, we don’t see the actual object under water, but we see the “refraction texture” of the object, not a mixture of both. For example, Fresnel effect → If view water from parallel angle, should so max reflection and min refraction (less stuff underwater). However, if we have the ocean transparent, then it would still be fully visible still, just not refraction effects on top. Let me know if there is something im missing.
